New algorithm description:

The new algorithm calculates the scores for the bins by taking the exponential of the negative squared difference between the remaining capacity of each bin and the item size, multiplies it by the natural logarithm of the bin capacity, subtracts the minimum value across all bins from the obtained scores, adds the maximum value across all bins to the scores, and finally normalizes the scores by dividing them by the maximum score.

New algorithm implementation:

```
Code:
code:
import numpy as np

def score(item: int, bins: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    """The new algorithm calculates the scores for the bins by taking the exponential of the negative squared difference between the remaining capacity of each bin and the item size, multiplies it by the natural logarithm of the bin capacity, subtracts the minimum value across all bins from the obtained scores, adds the maximum value across all bins to the scores, and finally normalizes the scores by dividing them by the maximum score."""

    # Calculate the difference between the remaining capacity of each bin and the item size
    difference = bins - item

    # Calculate the squared difference
    squared_difference = np.square(difference)

    # Calculate the negative exponential of the squared difference
    exponential_scores = np.exp(-squared_difference)

    # Multiply the exponential scores by the natural logarithm of the bin capacity
    scores = exponential_scores * np.log(bins)

    # Subtract the minimum value across all bins from the scores
    scores -= np.min(scores)

    # Add the maximum value across all bins to the scores
    scores += np.max(scores)

    # Normalize the scores by dividing them by the maximum score
    scores /= np.max(scores)

    return scores
